title: Rubocop failing for generator user.rb after first initialized rails 8
body:
### Steps to reproduce
<!-- (Guidelines for creating a bug report are [available
here](https://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/contributing_to_ruby_on_rails.html#creating-a-bug-report)) -->

<!-- Paste your executable test case created from one of the scripts found [here](https://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/contributing_to_ruby_on_rails.html#create-an-executable-test-case) below: -->
```ruby
rails new app
cd app
./bin/rails g authentication
./bin/rubocop
```

### Expected behavior
<!-- Tell us what should happen -->
No rubocop warnings

### Actual behavior
<!-- Tell us what happens instead -->
rubocop saying:

```
Inspecting 34 files
.............C....................

Offenses:

app/models/user.rb:5:38: C: [Correctable] Layout/SpaceInLambdaLiteral: Do not use spaces between -> and ( in lambda literals.
  normalizes :email_address, with: -> e { e.strip.downcase }
                                     ^
app/models/user.rb:5:39: C: [Correctable] Style/StabbyLambdaParentheses: Wrap stabby lambda arguments with parentheses.
  normalizes :email_address, with: -> e { e.strip.downcase }
                                      ^

34 files inspected, 2 offenses detected, 2 offenses autocorrectable
```

### System configuration
**Rails version**: [8.0.0.beta1](https://github.com/rails/rails/releases/tag/v8.0.0.beta1)

**Ruby version**: 3.3.5
